titlePart.text: PREPARATIONS FOR MEDICAL, DENTAL, OR TOILET PURPOSES

noteParagraph.text: This sub-class includes the following subject matter, whether set forth as a composition (mixture), process of preparing the composition or process of treating using the composition:

Drug and other biological compositions which are capable of: Preventing, alleviating, treating or curing abnormal and pathological conditions of the living body by such means as destroying a parasitic organism, or limiting the effect of the disease or abnormality by chemically altering the physiology of the host or parasite (biocides ), Maintaining, increasing, decreasing, limiting, or destroying a physiological body function, e.g. vitamin compositions, sex sterilants, fertility inhibitors, growth promotors, etc. (plant growth regulators ), Diagnosing a physiological condition or state by an in vivo test, e.g. X-ray contrast and skin patch test compositions (measuring or testing processes involving enzymes of micro-organisms ; in vitro testing of biological material, e.g. blood, urine, , e.g. ).
Body treating compositions generally intended for deodorising, protecting, adorning or grooming a body, e.g. cosmetics, dentifrices, tooth filling materials.
Attention is drawn to the definitions of groups of chemical elements following the title of Section C.
In this sub-class, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, an invention is classified in the last appropriate place.

In groups it is desirable to add, in conformity with paragraph 80 of the Guide, after the double oblique stroke the symbols relating to complementary information concerning individual components of a substance which is already classified as such as a technical subject.

titlePart.text: Use of preparations for artificial teeth, for filling or for capping teeth
Use of natural or synthetic resins

titlePart.entryReference: casings or accessories for storing or handling of solid or pasty toilet or cosmetic substances

titlePart.text: Face or body powders for grooming, adorning or absorbing
Preparations, e.g. lotions or powders, for care of the hair
Preparations to promote hair growth or to aid in hair removal, e.g. shaving preparations
Preparations for waving or straightening the hair

titlePart.entryReference: soaps or detergent compositions, e.g. shaving soaps,

titlePart.text: Preparations for cleaning the teeth or mouth, e.g. tooth-pastes
Preparations containing compounds releasing oxygen or chlorine
Preparations containing ammonia, amines or derivatives thereof, e.g. urea
Preparations containing hydroxy-carboxylic acids or derivatives thereof, i.e. compounds wherein the oxygen of the hydroxy group and the carbonyl of the carboxylic acid group are retained
Preparations containing plant or animal extracts, e.g. chlorophyll

Chemical agents brought into direct contact with the skin of living human or animal bodies for affording protection against external influences, e.g. sunlight, X- or other active rays, corrosive materials, bacteria, insect stings
titlePart.entryReference: chemical means for combating harmful chemical agents

titlePart.text: Topical sun or radiation screening or tanning preparations
Preparations containing aromatic acids or derivatives thereof, e.g. aminobenzoic acid, methyl salicylate
Preparations for the care of the skin
Medicinal preparations characterised by special physical form

titlePart.entryReference: devices for introducing into the body

titlePart.text: Layered or laminated unitary dosage forms
containing waxes, higher fatty acids, higher fatty alcohols, or derivatives thereof, e.g. chocolate
Preparations in capsules, e.g. of gelatin, of chocolate
containing discrete particles with coatings of different thicknesses or different materials

titlePart.entryReference: compositions of bandages or dressings with incorporated medicaments

titlePart.text: Medicinal preparations containing organic active ingredients
Nitro compounds, i.e. having NO2 groups
the aromatic ring being substituted by halogen
the aromatic ring being substituted by nitro groups
having an ether linkage to aromatic ring nuclear carbon
having two or more such linkages
Sulphur, selenium, or tellurium compounds, e.g. thioalcohols
having benzene rings, e.g. ephedrine, epinephrines
Anhydrides, halides or salt thereof, e.g. sulphur acids
Amino acids, e.g. pantothenic acid, vitamin B5
titlePart.entryReference: proteinaceous products not degraded to individual amino acids

titlePart.text: Higher fatty acids, i.e. having at least seven carbon atoms in an unbroken chain bound to a carboxyl group
Amine addition salts of organic acids
Inner quaternary ammonium salts, e.g. betaine
Higher fatty acids, i.e. having at least seven carbon atoms in an unbroken chain bound to a carboxyl group, e.g. castor oil
having an aromatic ring attached to a carboxyl group
having an amino or nitro group
Amino benzoic acid types, e.g. procaine, novocaine
with polyoxyalkylated alcohols, e.g. esters of polyethylene glycol
of sulphoxy acids or sulphur analogues thereof
of carbonic, thiocarbonic or thiocarboxylic acids, e.g. thioacetic acid, xanthogenic acid, trithiocarbonic acid
having oxygen as the only ring hetero atom
having five-membered rings with one oxygen as the only ring hetero atom
having six-membered rings with one oxygen as the only ring hetero atom
having sulphur as a ring hetero atom
having two or more sulphur atoms in the same ring
having oxygen in the same ring
having nitrogen as a ring hetero atom
having five-membered rings with one nitrogen as the only ring hetero atom, e.g. chlorophyll, phthalimide, hematoporphyrin
having five-membered rings with two or more ring hetero atoms, at least one of which is nitrogen, e.g. triazoles
having six-membered rings with one nitrogen as the only ring hetero atom
having an indole ring, e.g. alkaloids such as rauwolfia, yohimbine, reserpine, strychnine
Opium alkaloids, e.g. morphine, papaverine, codeine
having six-membered rings with two nitrogen atoms as the only ring hetero atoms
having six-membered rings with three nitrogens as the only ring hetero atoms
having six-membered rings with at least one nitrogen and one oxygen as the ring hetero atoms
having six-membered rings with at least one nitrogen and one sulphur as the ring hetero atoms
Compounds containing cyclopentanohydro- phenanthrene ring systems, e.g. lanolin
not substituted in position 17 beta by a carbon atom, e.g. estrane, androstane
substituted in position 17 beta by a chain of two carbon atoms, e.g. pregnane
substituted in position 17 beta by a chain of three or more carbon atoms, e.g. cholane, cholestane
Compounds containing 9, 10-seco-cyclopentano- hydrophenanthrene ring systems, e.g. vitamin D, i.e. "activated ergosterol", ergocalciferol, cholecalciferol, antirachitic vitamin
with additional carboxylic acids, or esters or metal salts thereof
Compounds containing para-N-benzene- sulphonyl-N-groups, e.g. sulphanilamide p-nitrobenzene-sulphonyl- hydrazone
Compounds containing a ring system of three fused rings, having an amino or amino-alkylene radical attached to the central ring
Azo, diazo, azoxy, azido or diazoamino compounds
having oxygen as a ring hetero atom
having sulphur as a ring hetero atom
having nitrogen as a ring hetero atom
Amine salts of phosphorus acids, e.g. lecithin
containing acid groups, e.g. heparin, agar-agar, pectin
containing substituents not provided for in groups
of acrylic acid or derivatives thereof
Polymers containing hetero atoms not provided for in groups
Medicinal preparations containing inorganic active ingredients
Elemental carbon, e.g. charcoal, carbon black
Medicinal preparations containing material or reaction products thereof with undetermined constitution
Glands not provided for in one of the preceding sub-groups of this main group
Materials from animals other than mammals or birds
Medicinal preparations containing proteinaceous materials, lipoids, or derivatives thereof
Scleroproteins, e.g. gelatin, fibrin, elastin, myosin, keratin, silk fibroin
Mixtures of enzymes selected from more than one of the groups
Medicinal preparations containing antigens or antibodies of unknown structure

noteParagraph.text: Preparation of antigen or antibody compositions is also classified in subclass , if the step of cultivating the micro-organism is of interest.
Groups cover preparations containing protozoa, bacteria, viruses, or subunits thereof, e.g. membrane parts.

titlePart.text: Chlamydiaceae, e.g. Chlamydia trachomatis or Chlamydia psittaci
Retroviridae, e.g. equine infectious anemia virus
Coronaviridae, e.g. avian infectious bronchitis virus
Mixtures of viral and bacterial antigens
Haptens or antigens, bound to carriers
characterised by the immunostimulating additives, e.g. chemical adjuvants
Medicinal preparations obtained by treating materials with wave energy or particle radiation
Medicinal preparations containing active ingredients not provided for in groups
Immunological preparations stimulating the recticulo-endothelial system, e.g. against cancer
Mixtures of active ingredients without chemical characterisation, e.g. antiphlogistics and cardiaca
Mixtures of an active ingredient and an auxiliary substance neither being chemically characterised, e.g. antihistaminicum and surface active substance
Medicinal preparations characterised by the nonactive ingredients used, e.g. carriers, inert additives
